title: US Considers More Chip Tariffs | Bloomberg Tech 8/5/2025
description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss President Donald Trump’s comments that more chip tariffs may be coming soon. Plus, booming demand for artificial intelligence led Palantir’s revenue to climb above $1 billion. And AMD is under pressure to show benefits from the AI race as the chipmaker prepares to release earnings after markets close. (Source: Bloomberg)
content:
00:00

title: Super Micro (SMCI) Q4 earnings report 2025
description: The server maker's business is still getting a big boost from artificial intelligence, but growth is slowing.
content:
Charles Liang, CEO of Super Micro, speaks at the Computex conference in Taipei, Taiwan, on June 1, 2023.

title: AI Boom Leads to Exploding Valuations
description: Demand for artificial intelligence has led to soaring valuations for some tech companies, even as US policy uncertainty remains. Stephanie Aliaga, global market strategist from JPMorgan’s Asset Management Market Insights Team, joins Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow on "Bloomberg Tech." (Source: Bloomberg)
content:
00:00
We look at something like Palantir, a 500% in 12 months, the most expensive stock on the S & P 500 when you're looking at where it prices versus future sales. Does it seem vindicated to you, these sorts of valuations? There's absolutely some en... [6406 chars]

title: Super Micro's quarterly revenue misses estimates
description: Super Micro missed Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Tuesday, hit by intense competition from larger server makers for high-performance computers used to train artificial-intelligence models. Shares of the San Jose, California-based firm fell 11% in extended trading. The AI server market is becoming more competitive as many companies launch advanced servers and rack configurations.
content:
(Reuters) -Super Micro missed Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue on Tuesday, hit by intense competition from larger server makers for high-performance computers used to train artificial-intelligence models.
Shares of the San Jose, Calif... [370 chars]

title: Super Micro's quarterly results underwhelm, shares fall
description: Super Micro missed Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue and profit on Tuesday, as the company battles larger server makers for high-performance computers used to train artificial-intelligence models. Shares of the San Jose, California-based firm slumped 10.5% in extended trading. They have soared 91% this year, as investors bet on strong demand for its AI servers and its liquid cooling solutions.
content:
(Reuters) -Super Micro missed Wall Street estimates for fourth-quarter revenue and profit on Tuesday, as the company battles larger server makers for high-performance computers used to train artificial-intelligence models.

description: Chainsaws? I think you mean "undeniable genius"
content: Executives at Microsoft, EA, Valve, and seemingly countless other gaming companies are either praying at the church of AI or actively chopping off their own legs through layoffs and other cost-cutting measures to invest in generative AI, but don't th... [2297 chars]

title: Clamps on AI could mire Australia in productivity mud
description: Introducing regulations just for artificial intelligence could prevent the technology from boosting Australia's drooping productivity, government is warned.
content:
Australia is urged to hold off imposing guardrails on high-risk artificial intelligence as the technology could offer a solution to the nation's withered productivity.
AI has been touted as a tool that could transform the global economy and is expect... [2204 chars]

title: OpenAI, Google and Anthropic win US approval for civilian AI contracts
description: The US government's central purchasing arm is adding OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.'s Google and Anthropic to a list of approved artificial intelligence vendors, opening the door to widespread adoption of the technology across civilian federal agencies.
content: (Bloomberg/Gregory Korte and Shirin Ghaffary) — The US government’s central purchasing arm is adding OpenAI, Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Anthropic to a list of approved artificial intelligence vendors, opening the door to widespread adoption of the te... [3188 chars]

title: AMD under pressure to show AI gains with stock beating Nvidia
description: Advanced Micro Devices Inc. earnings are expected to show the chipmaker is increasingly benefiting from the artificial intelligence arms race.
content: (Bloomberg/Ryan Vlastelica) — Advanced Micro Devices Inc. earnings are expected to show the chipmaker is increasingly benefiting from the artificial intelligence arms race. The question is whether it’s enough to justify a rally that has outpaced Nvid... [5733 chars]

title: OpenAI Releases Open-Weight Models After DeepSeek’s Success
description: OpenAI is releasing a pair of open and freely available artificial intelligence models that can mimic the human process of reasoning, months after China’s DeepSeek gained global attention with its own open AI software.
content:
